summary: A letter from the Department of Justice Office of the Inspector General to the New York City Office of the Chief Medical Examiner requesting the complete medical examiner's case file, including all reports, photos, and evidence, related to the death of inmate Jeffrey Epstein at the Metropolitan Correctional Center.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the medical examiner's investigation whose complete case file is being requested by the DOJ OIG.

persons.name: Special Agent in Charge
persons.role: Special Agent in Charge, New York Field Office, DOJ OIG
persons.context: The author of the letter requesting the medical examiner's file on Jeffrey Epstein's death.

events.title: Death of Jeffrey Epstein
events.description: The death of inmate Jeffrey Epstein at the Metropolitan Correctional Center, which is the subject of the requested medical examiner's case file.

locations: Office of the Chief Medical Examiner, City of New York, 520 First Avenue, New York, NY 10016
One Battery Park Plaza, 29th Floor, New York, NY 10004
keyFacts: The DOJ Office of the Inspector General is formally requesting the complete medical examiner's case file on Jeffrey Epstein's death.
The request is dated March 2, 2022, indicating ongoing official interest in the circumstances of Epstein's death years after the event.
The request seeks all documentation, including the examiner's report, notes, photos, evidence, and x-rays.
The request is directed to the New York City Office of the Chief Medical Examiner.
The letter implies the OIG is conducting an investigation or review related to Epstein's death.
